title: Quiz 4: FQE Feb 2023
description: Full exam paper from February 2023 FQE covering MCQs, Short Answer Questions on postnatal care and preterm labor, and an Infertility case study.

questions.question: Which one of the following is an early sign/symptom of cancer of the cervix?
questions.explanation: Post-coital bleeding (contact bleeding) is the classic early clinical presentation of cervical cancer. Weight loss and fistulas (stool per vagina) are late signs.

questions.question: Which one of the following is NOT a risk factor for cervical cancer?

options.text: Late onset initiation of sexual intercourse

questions.explanation: Early onset of sexual activity is a risk factor due to the immature transformation zone. Late onset is protective.
questions.hint: Which of these reduces exposure to HPV?

questions.question: Mary is a prima gravida at 20/40 gestation and lives in Nyeri. Which of the following prevention strategies of iron deficiency anemia does NOT apply?
questions.explanation: Nyeri is a malaria-free/low-risk zone in Kenya. Routine malaria control (IPTp) is not a primary strategy there compared to endemic zones.

questions.question: Components of individual Birth plan include the following EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: A Birth Plan is a logistical plan (Transport, Funds, Donor, Companion). Personal hygiene advice is health education, not a logistical component.
questions.hint: Which one is education rather than planning?

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a danger sign of a mother during post-partum period?
questions.explanation: Lochia discharge is normal. Umbilicus draining pus is a danger sign for the BABY. Excessive bleeding and mental disturbance are danger signs for the mother.

questions.question: A pregnant woman is said to have severe Anaemia in pregnancy if her hemoglobin level is:
questions.explanation: Severe anemia is typically defined as Hb < 7.0 g/dl. Moderate is 7-9.9 g/dl.

questions.question: Jackline presents at casualty with painless PV bleeding for the last 2 hours. The bleeding is bright red and heavy. No abdominal pain. Fundal height 36/40. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation: Painless, bright red, heavy bleeding without uterine tenderness is the classic presentation of Placenta Previa.

questions.question: Which of the following is a confirmatory sign of pre-labour premature rupture of membranes?

options.text: Fluid seen escaping from cervical canal on speculum examination

questions.explanation: Direct visualization of fluid escaping the os (pooling) is diagnostic.

questions.question: Maternal causes of preterm labour include the following EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Polyhydramnios is often classified as a uterine or fetal factor (overdistension) rather than a direct maternal condition like age or infection.
questions.hint: Which is related to fluid volume?

questions.question: All the following changes occur to the fetal circulation within minutes of birth EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: The hepatic portal system remains patent. The Ductus Venosus, Ductus Arteriosus, Foramen Ovale, and Umbilical vessels all close.
questions.hint: Which vessel supplies the liver permanently?

questions.question: Regarding syphilis in pregnancy, the following is NOT true:

options.text: Screening should be done at 1st contact
Rapid syphilis test can be used
Benzathine penicillin is the drug of choice

questions.explanation: VDRL is non-specific (screening). TPHA is specific (confirmatory).
questions.hint: Is VDRL for screening or confirmation?

questions.question: Management of labour in a woman with heart disease involves:

options.text: Put the patient in supine position

questions.explanation: Antibiotics prevent endocarditis. Supine position and fluid overload are dangerous.
questions.hint: Prevents infection of the heart valves.

questions.question: Which is a MATERNAL complication of diabetes in pregnancy?
questions.explanation: Hyperglycemia is the maternal state. RDS, Macrosomia, and Anomalies are fetal complications.

questions.question: Causes of seizures in pregnancy include all of the following EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: DVT causes swelling or embolism, not seizures.
questions.hint: A clotting disorder in the leg.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a maternal complication of malaria in pregnancy?
questions.explanation: Spontaneous abortion is loss of the fetus (fetal outcome). The others are direct maternal pathologies.
questions.hint: Which one refers to the fetus?

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT recommended during or before labour?
questions.explanation: Routine shaving increases infection risk and is not recommended.

questions.question: The following intervention has been shown to reduce the risk of vertical transmission of HIV:

options.text: Rupture of membranes to expedite labor

questions.explanation: Viral suppression via ART is the most effective method. ARM and Episiotomy increase transmission risk.

questions.question: Which of the following is a MATERNAL unfavorable outcome of Normal Labour?
questions.explanation: Birth injuries (tears, fistula) affect the mother directly.

questions.question: Normal Fetal Heart rate range is:
questions.explanation: 120-160 bpm is the standard range taught in this curriculum.

questions.question: Fetal indication of induction of labour is:
questions.explanation: Post term induction is primarily for fetal salvage due to placental aging.

questions.question: Which of the following investigations is carried out for purpose of evidence in a rape survivor?
questions.explanation: Presence of sperm confirms sexual contact.

questions.question: The commonest cause of obstetric fistula is:
questions.explanation: Prolonged obstructed labor causes pressure necrosis.

questions.question: The following conditions cause fundal height to be greater than expected EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Intrauterine Fetal Death (IUFD) causes the uterus to stop growing or regress.
questions.hint: In which condition does the fetus stop growing?

questions.question: Purity, 22 years, has a 21-day cycle. LMP 20th Oct 2022. Calculate EDD.
questions.explanation: Standard Naegele: 20 + 7 = 27th July. Cycle adjustment: 28 - 21 = 7 days short. Subtract 7 days from EDD. 27 - 7 = 20th July 2023.
questions.hint: Short cycle means earlier ovulation and earlier EDD.

questions.question: Margaret (36y) has 5 children at home. History of twins on 2 occasions, one ectopic at 10 weeks. She is currently 32 weeks pregnant. What is her parity?
questions.explanation: Children = 5. Twins x2 (4 kids) + 1 Singleton (1 kid) = 3 Delivery events. Para 3. Ectopic = +1. Current Pregnancy + Ectopic + 3 Deliveries = Gravida 5. Result: Para 3+1 G5.
questions.hint: Count delivery events, not number of babies.

questions.question: Most common cause of edema in pregnancy is:
questions.explanation: Physiological edema affects 80% of pregnant women.

questions.question: Majority of post-partum hemorrhage cases are caused by:

options.text: Failure of the uterus to contract

questions.explanation: Uterine Atony (Tone) causes 70% of PPH.

questions.question: Which of the following is a late sign observed in primi-gravida with obstructed labour?
questions.explanation: Bandl's ring (Pathological Retraction Ring) indicates imminent rupture.

questions.question: Characteristic complaint in a woman suspected to have low lying placenta at 34 weeks’ gestation is:
questions.explanation: Painless bleeding is hallmark of Previa. Painful is Abruption.

questions.question: Indications for breech vaginal delivery:

options.text: Advanced labour and the delivery is imminent

questions.explanation: If the baby is coming out (imminent) in advanced labor, vaginal delivery is unavoidable.

questions.question: Common cause of septic shock is:
questions.explanation: RTI is an infection, leading to sepsis. The others are cardiac/obstructive causes.

questions.question: Commonest cause of urinary tract infection in pregnancy is:
questions.explanation: E. coli causes most UTIs.

questions.question: Normal post-partum discharge 10 days after delivery is:
questions.explanation: Lochia Serosa lasts up to day 10-14 before turning to Alba.

questions.question: Which of the following is a positive sign of pregnancy?
questions.explanation: Objective signs by examiner (Fetal heart, US, Palpable movement) are positive signs.

questions.question: Direct causes of maternal mortality in Kenya:
questions.explanation: Hemorrhage is the leading direct cause. HIV/Malaria are indirect.

questions.question: A feature consistent with threatened abortion:

options.text: Fundal height is less than GBD

questions.explanation: Closed cervix and slight bleeding characterizes Threatened abortion.

questions.question: Regarding ectopic pregnancy, the earliest to rupture at 6-8 weeks is:
questions.explanation: Isthmus is the narrowest part, leading to early rupture.

questions.question: Menses that are too frequent with a cycle less than 21 days are referred to as:
questions.explanation: Polymenorrhea = Many periods (frequent).

questions.question: Regarding hormonal changes in menopause:

options.text: There is no reduction in circulating androgens
There is reduced endogenous estrogen production

questions.explanation: Estrogen drops, causing LH/FSH to rise.

questions.question: The major etiological in genital prolapse in women of reproductive age is:
questions.explanation: Childbirth trauma damages pelvic floor support.

questions.question: Outline 5 maternal elements of targeted post-natal care: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Key maternal checks: Vitals, Bleeding, Wound, Breasts, FP.

questions.question: Outline symptoms of pre-term labour: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Signs include contractions, backache, pressure, and discharge change.

questions.question: Outline the management of septic abortion: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Fluids, Antibiotics, and Evacuation are key.

questions.question: Match the abnormal bleeding pattern with its description:
questions.explanation: Standard definitions of AUB.

questions.question: Outline immediate newborn care steps: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Warmth, Airway, APGAR, Cord, ID, Eye care/Vit K.

questions.question: Identify ABSOLUTE indicators for Caesarean Section: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: CPD, Previa, Transverse lie, Cord prolapse are absolute. Breech is relative.
questions.hint: Situations where vaginal delivery is impossible or fatal.

questions.question: Outline immediate complications of FGM: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Pain, bleeding, shock, and urine retention occur immediately. Keloids are long-term.

questions.question: Enumerate predisposing factors for preeclampsia: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Risk factors: First pregnancy, Age, Twins, Chronic HTN, Diabetes. Smoking actually reduces risk (paradoxically).

questions.question: A couple presents with infertility of 1 year. Select possible FEMALE causes: (Select all that apply)

richContent.content: Clinical Scenario: A couple presents with inability to conceive for 1 year despite regular coitus.

questions.explanation: Female causes: Tubes, Ovaries, Uterus, Cervix.
questions.hint: Structural or hormonal issues in the woman.

questions.question: For the same couple, what history should be obtained from the MALE partner? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Male history: Infections (Mumps), STIs, Sexual function, Lifestyle toxins.
